newsitem.title: SOUTH AFRICA: RUGBY UNION-GIBBS SUSPENDED FOR ONE MATCH.
newsitem.headline: RUGBY UNION-GIBBS SUSPENDED FOR ONE MATCH.

text.p: British Lions centre Scott Gibbs was suspended for one match on Sunday after being found guilty of punching Northern Transvaal winger Grant Esterhuizen.

Gibbs will miss Wednesday's match against the Gauteng Lions (formerly Transvaal) but will still have two matches in which to impress before the side is named for the first test against South Africa on June 21.
A three-man disciplinary committee found Gibbs guilty of striking a glancing blow. Esterhuizen was not injured.

They also took into account Gibbs's experience of rugby league which had accustomed him to a more aggressive style of rugby, said South African Rugby Football Union press officer Alex Broun after the hearing.
Lions manager Fran Cotton said: "We received a fair hearing and accept the decision."
Gibbs struck the blow shortly after coming on as a replacement as the Lions lost their four match unbeaten record, going down 35-30 to Northern Transvaal.
